title: The Wall Street Journal: Northrop Grumman may be to blame for botched satellite launch in January
text:
Government and industry experts have tentatively concluded that engineering and testing errors by Northrop Grumman Corp. caused a U.S. spy satellite to plummet into the ocean shortly after a January launch, according to people familiar with the details.

Initial indications were that the satellite, believed to cost as much as $3.5 billion to develop and known by the code name Zuma, didnâ€™t separate in time from the spent second stage of a Space Exploration Technologies Corp. rocket. But now, these people said, two separate teams...
